union closed set system.definition_text: A set system $\F$ is \emph{union closed} if for all $A,B \in \F$ we have $A \cup B \in \F$.

union closed.definition_text: A set system is called union closed if for any two sets in the set system their union is also in the set system. A set system \(\F\) is \emph{union closed} if for all \(A,B \in \F\) we have \(A \cup B \in \F\).

c-approximate union closed set system.definition_text: A set system $\F$ is $c$-approximate union closed if for at least a $c$-fraction of the pairs $A,B \in \F$ we have $A \cup B \in \F$.

f.definition_text: Let $f:[0,1]^2 \to \mathbb{R}_{\ge 0}$ be defined as $$ f(x,y) := \frac{h(xy)}{h(x)y + h(y)x} $$ for $(x,y) \in (0,1)^2$ and extended (continuously) to $[0,1]^2$ by setting $f(x,y) = 1$ if $x \in \{0,1\}$ or $y \in \{0,1\}$.

varphi.definition_text: Let $\varphi = 1-\psi =\frac{\sqrt{5}-1}{2}$ be the positive root of $x^2+x-1=0$.

h.definition_text: Let $h(x) = -(x \log x + (1-x) \log (1-x))$ be the binary entropy function.
